greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct primes of the form floor(n/k) for 1<=k<=n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Randell Heyman, Cardinality of a floor function, arXiv:1905.00533 [math.NT], 2019.
example: a(10)=3 as floor(10/k) for k = 1 to 10 is 10,5,3,2,2,1,1,1,1,1, respectively; the 3 primes are 5,3,2.
program: (PARI) a(n) = #select(x->isprime(x), Set(vector(n, k, n\k))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 04 2019
xref: Cf. A055086 (number of distinct integers with same form). - _Michel Marcus_, May 04 2019
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Feb 12 2002
